trans-unit.source: Launch the default app for a URI
trans-unit.target: Launch the default app for a URI

trans-unit.source: Learn how to launch the default app for a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to launch the default app for a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

trans-unit.source: URIs allow you to launch another app to perform a specific task.
trans-unit.target: URIs allow you to launch another app to perform a specific task.

trans-unit.source: This topic also provides an overview of the many URI schemes built into Windows.
trans-unit.target: This topic also provides an overview of the many URI schemes built into Windows.

trans-unit.source: Launch the default app for a URI
trans-unit.target: Launch the default app for a URI

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: LaunchUriAsync
trans-unit.target: LaunchUriAsync

trans-unit.target: PreferredApplicationPackageFamilyName

trans-unit.source: Learn how to launch the default app for a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to launch the default app for a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

trans-unit.source: URIs allow you to launch another app to perform a specific task.
trans-unit.target: URIs allow you to launch another app to perform a specific task.

trans-unit.source: This topic also provides an overview of the many URI schemes built into Windows.
trans-unit.target: This topic also provides an overview of the many URI schemes built into Windows.

trans-unit.source: You can launch custom URIs too.
trans-unit.target: You can launch custom URIs too.

trans-unit.source: For more info about registering a custom URI scheme and handling URI activation, see [Handle URI activation](handle-uri-activation.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info about registering a custom URI scheme and handling URI activation, see [Handle URI activation](handle-uri-activation.md).

trans-unit.source: How to launch a URI
trans-unit.target: How to launch a URI

trans-unit.source: URI schemes let you open apps by clicking hyperlinks.
trans-unit.target: URI schemes let you open apps by clicking hyperlinks.

trans-unit.source: Just as you can start a new email using **mailto:**, you can open the default web browser using **http:**.
trans-unit.target: Just as you can start a new email using **mailto:**, you can open the default web browser using **http:**.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes some of the URI schemes built into Windows:
trans-unit.target: This topic describes some of the URI schemes built into Windows:

trans-unit.source: The [ms-settings: URI scheme](#settings) launches the Windows Settings app
trans-unit.target: The [ms-settings: URI scheme](#settings) launches the Windows Settings app

trans-unit.source: The [ms-store: URI scheme](#store) launches the Windows Store app
trans-unit.target: The [ms-store: URI scheme](#store) launches the Windows Store app

trans-unit.source: The [http: URI scheme](#browser) launches the default web browser
trans-unit.target: The [http: URI scheme](#browser) launches the default web browser

trans-unit.source: The [mailto: URI scheme](#email) launches the default email app
trans-unit.target: The [mailto: URI scheme](#email) launches the default email app

trans-unit.source: The [bingmaps:, ms-drive-to:, and ms-walk-to: URI schemes](#maps) launch the Windows Maps app
trans-unit.target: The [bingmaps:, ms-drive-to:, and ms-walk-to: URI schemes](#maps) launch the Windows Maps app

trans-unit.source: For example, the following URI opens the default browser and displays the Bing web site.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following URI opens the default browser and displays the Bing web site.

trans-unit.source: You can also launch custom URI schemes too.
trans-unit.target: You can also launch custom URI schemes too.

trans-unit.source: If there is no app installed to handle that URI, you can recommend an app ror the user to install.
trans-unit.target: If there is no app installed to handle that URI, you can recommend an app ror the user to install.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Recommend an app](#recommend).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Recommend an app](#recommend).

trans-unit.source: In general, your app can't select the app that is launched.
trans-unit.target: In general, your app can't select the app that is launched.

trans-unit.source: The user determines which app is launched.
trans-unit.target: The user determines which app is launched.

trans-unit.source: More than one app can register to handle the same URI scheme.
trans-unit.target: More than one app can register to handle the same URI scheme.

trans-unit.source: The exception to this is for reserved URI schemes.
trans-unit.target: The exception to this is for reserved URI schemes.

trans-unit.source: Registrations of reserved URI schemes are ignored.
trans-unit.target: Registrations of reserved URI schemes are ignored.

trans-unit.source: For the full list of reserved URI schemes, see [Handle URI activation](handle-uri-activation.md).
trans-unit.target: For the full list of reserved URI schemes, see [Handle URI activation](handle-uri-activation.md).

trans-unit.source: In cases where more than one app may have registered the same URI scheme, your app can recommend a specific app to be launched.
trans-unit.target: In cases where more than one app may have registered the same URI scheme, your app can recommend a specific app to be launched.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Recommend an app](#recommend).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Recommend an app](#recommend).

trans-unit.source: Call LaunchUriAsync
trans-unit.target: Call LaunchUriAsync

trans-unit.source: Use the [**LaunchUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701476) method to launch a URI.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**LaunchUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701476) method to launch a URI.

trans-unit.source: When you call this method, your app must be the foreground app, that is, it must be visible to the user.
trans-unit.target: When you call this method, your app must be the foreground app, that is, it must be visible to the user.

trans-unit.source: This requirement helps ensure that the user remains in control.
trans-unit.target: This requirement helps ensure that the user remains in control.

trans-unit.source: To meet this requirement, make sure that you tie all URI launches directly to the UI of your app.
trans-unit.target: To meet this requirement, make sure that you tie all URI launches directly to the UI of your app.

trans-unit.source: The user must always take some action to initiate a URI launch.
trans-unit.target: The user must always take some action to initiate a URI launch.

trans-unit.source: If you attempt to launch a URI and your app isn't in the foreground, the launch will fail and your error callback will be invoked.
trans-unit.target: If you attempt to launch a URI and your app isn't in the foreground, the launch will fail and your error callback will be invoked.

trans-unit.source: First create a [**System.Uri**](T:System.Uri) object to represent the URI, then pass that to the [**LaunchUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701476) method.
trans-unit.target: First create a [**System.Uri**](T:System.Uri) object to represent the URI, then pass that to the [**LaunchUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701476) method.

trans-unit.source: Use the return result to see if the call succeeded, as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: Use the return result to see if the call succeeded, as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, the operating system will prompt the user to see if the actually want to switch apps.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, the operating system will prompt the user to see if the actually want to switch apps.

trans-unit.source: a warning dialog overlayed on a grayed out background of the app.
trans-unit.target: a warning dialog overlayed on a grayed out background of the app.

trans-unit.source: the dialog asks the user if they want to switch apps and has ‘yes’ and ‘no’ buttons in the bottom right.
trans-unit.target: the dialog asks the user if they want to switch apps and has ‘yes’ and ‘no’ buttons in the bottom right.

trans-unit.source: the ‘no’ button is highlighted.
trans-unit.target: the ‘no’ button is highlighted.

trans-unit.source: If you always want this prompt to occur, use the [**Windows.System.LauncherOptions.TreatAsUntrusted**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701442) property to indicate that the operating system display a warning.
trans-unit.target: If you always want this prompt to occur, use the [**Windows.System.LauncherOptions.TreatAsUntrusted**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701442) property to indicate that the operating system display a warning.

trans-unit.source: Recommend an app
trans-unit.target: Recommend an app

trans-unit.source: In some cases, the user might not have an app installed to handle the URI that you are launching.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, the user might not have an app installed to handle the URI that you are launching.

trans-unit.source: By default, the operating system handles these cases by providing the user with a link to search for an appropriate app on the store.
trans-unit.target: By default, the operating system handles these cases by providing the user with a link to search for an appropriate app on the store.

trans-unit.source: If you want to give the user a specific recommendation for which app to acquire in this scenario, you can do so by passing that recommendation along with the URI that you are launching.
trans-unit.target: If you want to give the user a specific recommendation for which app to acquire in this scenario, you can do so by passing that recommendation along with the URI that you are launching.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations are also useful when more than one app has registered to handle a URI scheme.
trans-unit.target: Recommendations are also useful when more than one app has registered to handle a URI scheme.

trans-unit.source: By recommending a specific app, Windows will open that app if it is already installed.
trans-unit.target: By recommending a specific app, Windows will open that app if it is already installed.

trans-unit.source: To make a recommendation, call the [**Windows.System.Launcher.LaunchUriAsync(Uri, LauncherOptions)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701484) method with [**LauncherOptions.preferredApplicationPackageFamilyName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh965482) set to the package family name of the app in the store that you want to recommend.
trans-unit.target: To make a recommendation, call the [**Windows.System.Launcher.LaunchUriAsync(Uri, LauncherOptions)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701484) method with [**LauncherOptions.preferredApplicationPackageFamilyName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh965482) set to the package family name of the app in the store that you want to recommend.

trans-unit.source: The operating system uses this info to replace the general option to search for an app in the store with a specific option to acquire the recommended app from the store.
trans-unit.target: The operating system uses this info to replace the general option to search for an app in the store with a specific option to acquire the recommended app from the store.

trans-unit.source: Set remaining view preference
trans-unit.target: Set remaining view preference

trans-unit.source: Source apps that call [**LaunchUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701476) can request that they remain on screen after a URI launch.
trans-unit.target: Source apps that call [**LaunchUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701476) can request that they remain on screen after a URI launch.

trans-unit.source: By default, Windows attempts to share all available space equally between the source app and the target app that handles the URI.
trans-unit.target: By default, Windows attempts to share all available space equally between the source app and the target app that handles the URI.

trans-unit.source: Source apps can use the [**DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314) property to indicate to the operating system that they prefer their app window to take up more or less of the available space.
trans-unit.target: Source apps can use the [**DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314) property to indicate to the operating system that they prefer their app window to take up more or less of the available space.

trans-unit.source: **DesiredRemainingView** can also be used to indicate that the source app doesn't need to remain on screen after the URI launch and can be completely replaced by the target app.
trans-unit.target: **DesiredRemainingView** can also be used to indicate that the source app doesn't need to remain on screen after the URI launch and can be completely replaced by the target app.

trans-unit.source: This property only specifies the preferred window size of the calling app.
trans-unit.target: This property only specifies the preferred window size of the calling app.

trans-unit.source: It doesn't specify the behavior of other apps that may happen to also be on screen at the same time.
trans-unit.target: It doesn't specify the behavior of other apps that may happen to also be on screen at the same time.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Windows takes into account multiple different factors when it determines the source app's final window size, for example, the preference of the source app, the number of apps on screen, the screen orientation, and so on.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Windows takes into account multiple different factors when it determines the source app's final window size, for example, the preference of the source app, the number of apps on screen, the screen orientation, and so on.

trans-unit.source: By setting [**DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314), you aren't guaranteed a specific windowing behavior for the source app.
trans-unit.target: By setting [**DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314), you aren't guaranteed a specific windowing behavior for the source app.

trans-unit.source: Windows Maps app URI schemes
trans-unit.target: Windows Maps app URI schemes

trans-unit.source: Your app can use the **bingmaps:**, **ms-drive-to:**, and **ms-walk-to:** URI schemes to [launch the Windows Maps app](launch-maps-app.md) to specific maps, directions, and search results.
trans-unit.target: Your app can use the **bingmaps:**, **ms-drive-to:**, and **ms-walk-to:** URI schemes to [launch the Windows Maps app](launch-maps-app.md) to specific maps, directions, and search results.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following URI opens the Windows Maps app and displays a map centered over New York City.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following URI opens the Windows Maps app and displays a map centered over New York City.

trans-unit.source: an example of the windows maps app.
trans-unit.target: an example of the windows maps app.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Maps app](launch-maps-app.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Maps app](launch-maps-app.md).

trans-unit.source: To use the map control in your own app, see [Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt219695).
trans-unit.target: To use the map control in your own app, see [Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt219695).

trans-unit.source: Windows Settings app URI scheme
trans-unit.target: Windows Settings app URI scheme

trans-unit.source: Your app can use the **ms-settings:** URI scheme to [launch the Windows Settings app](launch-settings-app.md).
trans-unit.target: Your app can use the **ms-settings:** URI scheme to [launch the Windows Settings app](launch-settings-app.md).

trans-unit.source: Launching to the Settings app is an important part of writing a privacy-aware app.
trans-unit.target: Launching to the Settings app is an important part of writing a privacy-aware app.

trans-unit.source: If your app can't access a sensitive resource, we recommend providing the user a convenient link to the privacy settings for that resource.
trans-unit.target: If your app can't access a sensitive resource, we recommend providing the user a convenient link to the privacy settings for that resource.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following URI opens the Settings app and displays the camera privacy settings.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following URI opens the Settings app and displays the camera privacy settings.

trans-unit.source: camera privacy settings.
trans-unit.target: camera privacy settings.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Settings app](launch-settings-app.md) and [Guidelines for privacy-aware apps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh768223).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Settings app](launch-settings-app.md) and [Guidelines for privacy-aware apps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh768223).

trans-unit.source: Windows Store app URI scheme
trans-unit.target: Windows Store app URI scheme

trans-unit.source: Your app can use the **ms-windows-store:** URI scheme to [Launch the Windows Store app](launch-store-app.md).
trans-unit.target: Your app can use the **ms-windows-store:** URI scheme to [Launch the Windows Store app](launch-store-app.md).

trans-unit.source: Open product detail pages, product review pages, and search pages, etc. For example, the following URI opens the Windows Store app and launches the home page of the Store.
trans-unit.target: Open product detail pages, product review pages, and search pages, etc. For example, the following URI opens the Windows Store app and launches the home page of the Store.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Store app](launch-store-app.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Store app](launch-store-app.md).

trans-unit.source: Call app URI scheme
trans-unit.target: Call app URI scheme

trans-unit.source: Your app can use the **ms-call:** URI scheme to launch the Call app.
trans-unit.target: Your app can use the **ms-call:** URI scheme to launch the Call app.

trans-unit.source: URI Scheme
trans-unit.target: URI Scheme

trans-unit.source: Results
trans-unit.target: Results

trans-unit.source: ms-call:settings
trans-unit.target: ms-call:settings

trans-unit.source: Launches the Calls app settings page.
trans-unit.target: Launches the Calls app settings page.

trans-unit.source: Chat app URI scheme
trans-unit.target: Chat app URI scheme

trans-unit.source: Your app can use the **ms-chat:** URI scheme to launch the Messaging app.
trans-unit.target: Your app can use the **ms-chat:** URI scheme to launch the Messaging app.

trans-unit.source: URI scheme
trans-unit.target: URI scheme

trans-unit.source: Results
trans-unit.target: Results

trans-unit.source: ms-chat:
trans-unit.target: ms-chat:

trans-unit.source: Launches the Messaging app.
trans-unit.target: Launches the Messaging app.

trans-unit.source: ms-chat:?ContactID={contacted}
trans-unit.target: ms-chat:?ContactID={contacted}

trans-unit.source: Allows the messaging application to be launched with a particular contact’s information.
trans-unit.target: Allows the messaging application to be launched with a particular contact’s information.

trans-unit.source: ms-chat:?Body={body}
trans-unit.target: ms-chat:?Body={body}

trans-unit.source: Allows the messaging application to be launched with a string to use as the content of the message.
trans-unit.target: Allows the messaging application to be launched with a string to use as the content of the message.

trans-unit.source: ms-chat:?Addresses={address}&Body={body}
trans-unit.target: ms-chat:?Addresses={address}&Body={body}

trans-unit.source: Allows the messaging application to be launched with a particular addresses' information, and with a string to use as the content of the message.
trans-unit.target: Allows the messaging application to be launched with a particular addresses' information, and with a string to use as the content of the message.

trans-unit.source: Note: Addresses can be concatenated.
trans-unit.target: Note: Addresses can be concatenated.

trans-unit.source: ms-chat:?TransportId={transportId}
trans-unit.target: ms-chat:?TransportId={transportId}

trans-unit.source: Allows the messaging application to be launched with a particular transport ID.
trans-unit.target: Allows the messaging application to be launched with a particular transport ID.

trans-unit.source: Email URI scheme
trans-unit.target: Email URI scheme

trans-unit.source: Your app can use the **mailto:** URI scheme to launch the default mail app.
trans-unit.target: Your app can use the **mailto:** URI scheme to launch the default mail app.

trans-unit.source: URI Scheme
trans-unit.target: URI Scheme

trans-unit.source: Results
trans-unit.target: Results

trans-unit.source: mailto:
trans-unit.target: mailto:

trans-unit.source: Launches the default email app.
trans-unit.target: Launches the default email app.

trans-unit.source: mailto:\[email address\]
trans-unit.target: mailto:\[email address\]

trans-unit.source: Launches the email app and creates a new message with the specified email address on the To line.
trans-unit.target: Launches the email app and creates a new message with the specified email address on the To line.

trans-unit.source: Note that the email is not sent until the user taps send.
trans-unit.target: Note that the email is not sent until the user taps send.

trans-unit.source: HTTP URI scheme
trans-unit.target: HTTP URI scheme

trans-unit.source: Your app can use the **http:** URI scheme to launch the default web browser.
trans-unit.target: Your app can use the **http:** URI scheme to launch the default web browser.

trans-unit.source: URI Scheme
trans-unit.target: URI Scheme

trans-unit.source: Results
trans-unit.target: Results

trans-unit.source: http:
trans-unit.target: http:

trans-unit.source: Launches the default web browser.
trans-unit.target: Launches the default web browser.

trans-unit.source: Nearby Numbers app URI scheme
trans-unit.target: Nearby Numbers app URI scheme

trans-unit.source: Your app can use the **ms-yellowpage:** URI scheme to launch the Nearby Numbers app.
trans-unit.target: Your app can use the **ms-yellowpage:** URI scheme to launch the Nearby Numbers app.

trans-unit.source: URI Scheme
trans-unit.target: URI Scheme

trans-unit.source: Results
trans-unit.target: Results

trans-unit.source: ms-yellowpage:?input=\[keyword\]&method=\[String
trans-unit.target: ms-yellowpage:?input=\[keyword\]&method=\[String

trans-unit.source: Launches the installed Point of Interest (POI) search app that supports this new URI.
trans-unit.target: Launches the installed Point of Interest (POI) search app that supports this new URI.

trans-unit.source: People app URI scheme
trans-unit.target: People app URI scheme

trans-unit.source: Your app can use the **ms-people:** URI scheme to launch the People app.
trans-unit.target: Your app can use the **ms-people:** URI scheme to launch the People app.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Launch the People app](launch-people-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Launch the People app](launch-people-apps.md).
